Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Dashboard \Dash"board`\ (d[a^]sh"b[=o]rd`), n. 1. A board placed on the fore part of a carriage, sleigh, or other vehicle, to intercept water, mud, or snow, thrown up by the heels of the horses; -- in England commonly called {splashboard}. [1913 Webster]
2. (Naut.) (a) The float of a paddle wheel. (b) A screen at the bow af a steam launch to keep off the spray; -- called also {sprayboard}. [1913 Webster]
3. an instrument panel beneath the front window of a motor vehicle (such as an automobile or truck), containing indicating gauges and dials, such as the speedometer and fuel gauges, and sometimes certain control knobs or other devices. [PJC]

dashboard n 1: protective covering consisting of a panel to protect people from the splashing water or mud etc. [syn: {splashboard}, {splasher}] 2: instrument panel on an automobile or airplane containing dials and controls
